msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-26363 - Spark ComboBox doesn't respect baseline constraint.

Updated the ComboBoxTextInputSkin. RichEditableText always returns the baseline position of the first line and ignores verticalAlign. The textDisplay no longer vertically stretches across the skin. This enables a more accurate baselinePosition.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-26314 - Cant get value of Spark Combobox with empty dataprovider
In ComboBox, when entering custom text, we make sure to set the selectedIndex to custom item mode. In ListBase, if there is no dataProvider, we allow the selectedIndex to be set to custom item mode.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fixing up same change event logic in List/ListBase that I noticed when looking around the code.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Fixing some issues with the caret index, specifically how it relates to selectedIndex.  When the selectedIndex gets set, it would short-circuit if the value was the same as the current selected index.  However, we also rely on that setter to change the caret index for us.  So, I added some logic in there to do just that and also cleaned up some places where we were setting caret index directly when the selectedIndex setter can just handle it for us.
There are still some places where we set selectedIndex and then set caretIndex.  Those shouldn't be necessary, but I didn't see a real reason to go through the code and remove them all.
Tests run: checkintests, mustella cyclone server run
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Adding a "down" state for item renderers when in touch interaction mode.  This means item renderers don't go in to the "selected" state when someone presses down on them.  They first go in to the "down" state.  If the user later starts scrolling or moving around, the item renderer returns to the "normal" state.  If they press down and release up on the same item, the item renderer will go from the "down" state to the "selected" state.  This distinction is necessary on touch devices to distinguish between "down" and "selected".  There's also a new "selectedAndDown" state.
Adding ItemRendererInterationStateDetector as a helper class for item renderer to help detect when they are indeed hovered or pressed down.
Tests run: checkintests, full mustella run, QA cyclone

The selected state of item renderers in ButtonBars are now properly cleared when the IndexChangeEvent.CHANGING event is canceled.
